title: Messe Frankfurt GmbH appoints Iris Jeglitza-Moshage Senior Vice President
text:
Messe Frankfurt GmbH appoints Iris Jeglitza-Moshage Senior Vice President Published on : Wednesday, August 5, 2015
Iris Jeglitza-Moshage (53) has been appointed Senior Vice President of Messe Frankfurt GmbH with effect from 1 August. In her new position, she will be adding the responsibilities of Chief of Communications to her function as a member of the Extended Board of Management of Messe Frankfurt Exhibition GmbH. Wolfgang Marzin, President and Chief Executive Officer of Messe Frankfurt, stated: “We are very pleased to appoint such a highly qualified and experienced trade fair and communications expert as Iris Jeglitza-Moshage to the position of Senior Vice President of our Group.” As part of the representative function within corporate communications, it is necessary that the position be given more weight both within and outside of the company – particularly with regard to interest groups and associations. The responsibilities of the Chief of Communications include the Corporate Communications, Corporate Marketing & Stakeholder Relations and Protocol departments. Event-specific product communication will continue to be the responsibility of the respective business divisions.
In her function as Senior Vice President at Messe Frankfurt Exhibition GmbH, Jeglitza-Moshage has been responsible for the ISH, Light+Building, IFFA and Texcare trade fair brands since 2010. At the same time, she is also responsible for the Safety & Security and Environment areas of expertise at Messe Frankfurt. In her additional function as Chief of Communications, she also reports to the President and Chief Executive Officer, Wolfgang Marzin. The Company Spokesman will continue to be Markus Quint, Head of Corporate Communications.
We would be happy to send you picture materials in printable resolution upon request.
Source: Messe Frankfurt
